title: Quiz 4: Absorption & Excretion
description: Assess your knowledge of the Digestive, Respiratory, and Urinary systems.

questions.question: Which organ produces bile to help emulsify fats?
questions.explanation: The Liver produces bile. The Gallbladder stores and concentrates it.
questions.hint: It is the largest internal organ.

questions.question: Arrange the parts of the respiratory tract in the order air flows during inhalation:
questions.explanation: Air enters nose -> Pharynx -> Larynx -> Trachea -> Bronchi -> Alveoli (gas exchange).

questions.question: The functional unit of the kidney responsible for filtering blood and forming urine is the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: There are over 1 million nephrons in each kidney, serving as the functional filtration units.

questions.question: Select the accessory organs of the digestive system. (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Accessory organs aid digestion but food does not pass through them. Stomach and intestines are part of the alimentary canal.
questions.hint: Organs that food does NOT pass through.

questions.question: Match the digestive enzyme/juice with its function:
questions.explanation: Amylase acts on carbs, Pepsin on proteins in acid, Bile on fats, Insulin regulates sugar.
questions.hint: Saliva works on starch; Stomach acid activates Pepsin.

questions.question: Gas exchange in the lungs occurs in the bronchi.
questions.explanation: Gas exchange occurs in the **alveoli**, the tiny air sacs at the end of the respiratory tree.

questions.question: What is the name of the flap-like structure that prevents food from entering the trachea during swallowing?
questions.explanation: The epiglottis covers the glottis (opening to larynx) during swallowing to prevent aspiration.

questions.question: Review the Urine Formation Table. What process occurs at Step 2?

richContent.content:
StepProcess
1Filtration (Glomerulus)
2?
3Secretion

questions.explanation: Step 2 is Reabsorption, where 99% of water and essential nutrients are taken back into the blood from the renal tubules.
questions.hint: Taking back what the body needs.

questions.question: In which part of the digestive tract does the most nutrient absorption occur?
questions.explanation: The small intestine (specifically jejunum and ileum) is the primary site for nutrient absorption via villi.
questions.hint: It has villi to increase surface area.

questions.question: Which muscle is primarily responsible for the breathing mechanism (inhalation)?
questions.explanation: Contraction of the diaphragm increases the volume of the thoracic cavity, causing inhalation.
questions.hint: It separates the chest from the abdomen.
